body:
Hi Pietro, I have written a new LB component which is based on Vicente's scripts, and I think is quite useful if you want to export your LB meshes.
Here's a simple example of terrain analysis: [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/7AOoV0m95HmYPC-e-A520XnmEqe-wi1pR4JyG43lR6yoCspOr9v0cpmZPX6qHmF61fQM27a-1Po4W2JLEjDKPFw8vJut6rK3/terrainanalysis_mesh_0.png) [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/7AOoV0m95HnCI9J2bPh2CWoRCo--0TBiKYY8r*0Xj*Soqn64hNc6unSWDU5fcHZy591oDdeEMmjPV8KeUsuu8CyxBz8OwOhC/Canvase_2bis.png) Texturing and Baking. [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/7AOoV0m95HnW5Fs0tyhdni5txg7mOEkFmR5krHJfCVuoOBr4-SHYSI-mP2JuV4SyeHHtXA*mVfbmG2LY1vUUYfNhdfaXMJts/terrainanalysis_mesh.png) From Rhino to Google Earth by using Kmz Generator. You can also export your Rhino model (+ material) as *.obj. In addiction, this component works well with "radiationMesh" and other type of meshes that come from LB analysis components. Best Antonello
